title: Practice Challenge

hints.text: Add `: string` to both interface properties, `: User` to the function parameter, and `: string` for the return type.

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
**Trying to convert everything at once**:
   - This is overwhelming and error-prone
   - Convert one file or module at a time
   - Start with core utilities, then work outward

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
**Using 'any' everywhere**:
   ```typescript
   function process(data: any): any {  // Bad!
     // ...
   }
   ```
   - This defeats the purpose of TypeScript
   - Take time to figure out the correct types
   - Use 'any' only as a temporary placeholder
